intro: Leptodermis gracilis, commonly known as the slender skin moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows on soil or rock surfaces in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a thin, delicate thallus with a smooth, greenish appearance and lacks true leaves. It reproduces through spores, which are released from capsule-like structures called sporocarps. Leptodermis gracilis is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in humid, low-light conditions.
